revision.comment: populating subcats of [[Category:Swiss expatriate sportspeople by country of residence]]. Some cats may not exist; 2b created in next step

{{Infobox football biography | name= Shani Tarashaj | image = | fullname = Shani Tarashaj | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1995|2|7}} | birth_place = [[Hausen am Albis]], Switzerland | height = {{height|m=1.76}} | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshoppers]]
(on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 21 | youthclubs1 = [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshoppers]] | youthyears1 = 2008–2014 | clubs1 = [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshoppers]] | clubs2 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | years1 = 2014–2016 | years2 = 2016– | caps1 = 37 | caps2 = 0 | goals1 = 9 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2016 | clubs3 = → [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshoppers]] (loan) | caps3 = 15 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2016–2017 | clubs4 = → [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] (loan) | caps4 = 15 | goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = → [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshoppers]] (loan) | caps5 = 3 | goals5 = 0 | nationalteam1 =[[Switzerland national under-17 football team|Switzerland U17]] |nationalteam2 = [[Switzerland national under-18 football team|Switzerland U18]] | nationalyears1 =2011–2012 |nationalyears2 = 2012 | nationalcaps1 =10 |nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals1 =6 |nationalgoals2 = 3 |nationalteam3 = [[Switzerland national under-19 football team|Switzerland U19]] |nationalyears3 = 2013–2014 |nationalcaps3 = 7 |nationalgoals3 = 7 |nationalteam4 = [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Switzerland U21]] |nationalyears4 = 2014–2016 |nationalcaps4 = 8 |nationalgoals4 = 5 |nationalteam5 =[[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] |nationalyears5 = 2016– |nationalcaps5 = 5 |nationalgoals5 = 0 | club-update = 09:19, 22 October 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 18:34, 1 July 2017 (UTC) }} '''Shani Tarashaj''' (born 7 February 1995) is a Swiss professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshoppers]] on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/shani-tarashaj/213353/|title=Switzerland – S. Tarashaj – Profile with news, career statistics and history – Soccerway|publisher=soccerway.com|accessdate=2014-08-21}} He was a member of the Swiss squad at [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. ==Background== Tarashaj's Albanian family emigrated from [[Prizren]], [[Kosovo]], in the early 1990s, escaping the [[Yugoslav wars]].{{citation needed|date=October 2018}} ==Club career== Tarashaj was born in [[Hausen am Albis]], Switzerland. He grew up in youth teams of [[Grasshopper Club Zürich]].{{cite web|url=http://www.basellandschaftlichezeitung.ch/sport/fussball/als-kleiner-bub-verehrte-gcs-shani-tarashaj-ronaldo-129423977|title=Als kleiner Bub verehrte GCs Shani Tarashaj Ronaldo|date=8 August 2015|publisher=}} Tarashaj made his [[Swiss Super League]] debut on 2 August 2014, coming on as a substitute for [[Alexander Merkel]] in a 0–0 draw against [[FC Sion]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/08/02/switzerland/super-league/grasshopper-club-zurich/fc-sion/1695131/|title= Grasshoppers vs. FC Sion – 2 August 2014 – Soccerway|publisher=soccerway.com|accessdate=2014-08-21}} Tarashaj started 2015–16 by scoring 5 goals in his first 4 games, including two [[brace (sports)|braces]] against [[FC Zurich]] and [[FC Lugano]]. His contract with Grasshopper was renewed, extended to 2019. On 7 January 2016, Tarashaj joined English club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on four-and-a-half year deal. He was loaned back to Grasshopper, until the end of the season so that he could complete his national service.{{cite news|title=Everton sign Swiss midfielder Tarashaj|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/35253228|accessdate=7 January 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=7 January 2016}} He was loaned to German club [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] for the 2016–17 season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/08/31/tarashaj-loaned-to-frankfurt|title=Tarashaj loaned to Frankfurt|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=31 August 2016|access-date=31 August 2016}} On 19 July 2018, Tarashaj returned to Grasshopper on a season-long loan deal with an option to make the deal permanent.{{cite web|url=https://www.gcz.ch/news/news/artikel/gc-verpflichtet-tarashaj/|title=GC VERPFLICHTET TARASHAJ|publisher=[[Grasshopper Club Zürich]]|date=19 July 2018|accessdate=19 July 2018|language=German}} ==International career== Tarashaj played for Switzerland's age-group teams, starting in 2011. Though he was sought by [[Albania national football team|Albania]], for whom he was also eligible to play,{{cite web|url=http://www.telegrafi.com/sport/de-biasi-manaj-tarashaj-dhe-kamberi-e-ardhmja-e-shqiperise-5-0-70701.html|title=De Biasi: Manaj, Tarashaj dhe Kamberi, e ardhmja e Shqipërisë – Telegrafi|date=7 August 2015|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151221095902/http://www.telegrafi.com/sport/de-biasi-manaj-tarashaj-dhe-kamberi-e-ardhmja-e-shqiperise-5-0-70701.html|archivedate=21 December 2015|df=}} he made his debut for the [[Switzerland national football team|senior Swiss team]] on 25 March 2016.{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/international-debut-shows-everton-stole-11118820|title=International debut shows Everton stole a march on rivals for Shani Tarashaj|newspaper=[[Liverpool Echo]]|date=31 March 2016}} He was selected for the Switzerland squad in [[UEFA Euro 2016]],{{cite web|url=http://www.football.ch/fr/Portaldata/1/Resources/webuploadextern/EURO_Kader.pdf |title=Liste des joueurs UEFA EURO 2016 FRANCE |publisher=Swiss Football Association |website=football.ch |date=30 May 2016}} but only made a single appearance, coming on as a late substitute against [[Romania national football team|Romania]]. ==Career statistics== {{Updated|6 May 2016}} {|
